org.jnativehook

Class GlobalScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jnativehook.GlobalScreen

  • public class GlobalScreen
extends Object
    GlobalScreen is used to represent the native screen area that Java does not usually have access to. This class can be thought of as the source component for native input events.

    This class also handles the loading, unpacking and communication with the native library. That includes registering and unregistering the native hook with the underlying operating system and adding global keyboard and mouse listeners.

    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Alexander Barker (alex@1stleg.com)

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws Throwable
        A destructor that will perform native cleanup by calling the unregisterNativeHook() method. This method will not run until the class is garbage collected.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable - a NativeHookException raised by calling unloadNativeLibrary()
        See Also:
        Object.finalize()

      • getInstance

        public static GlobalScreen getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of GlobalScreen.
        Returns:
        singleton instance of GlobalScreen

      • addNativeKeyListener

        public void addNativeKeyListener(NativeKeyListener listener)
        Adds the specified native key listener to receive key events from the native system. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        listener - a native key listener object

      • removeNativeKeyListener

        public void removeNativeKeyListener(NativeKeyListener listener)
        Removes the specified native key listener so that it no longer receives key events from the native system. This method performs no function if the listener specified by the argument was not previously added. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        listener - a native key listener object

      • addNativeMouseListener

        public void addNativeMouseListener(NativeMouseListener listener)
        Adds the specified native mouse listener to receive mouse events from the native system. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        listener - a native mouse listener object

      • removeNativeMouseListener

        public void removeNativeMouseListener(NativeMouseListener listener)
        Removes the specified native mouse listener so that it no longer receives mouse events from the native system. This method performs no function if the listener specified by the argument was not previously added. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        listener - a native mouse listener object

      • registerNativeHook

        public static void registerNativeHook()
                               throws NativeHookException
        Enable the native hook if it is not currently running. If it is running the function has no effect.

        Note: This method will throw a NativeHookException if specific operating system features are unavailable or disabled. For example: Access for assistive devices is unchecked in the Universal Access section of the System Preferences on Apple's OS X platform or Load "record" is missing for the xorg.conf file on Unix/Linux/Solaris platforms.

        Throws:
        NativeHookException - problem registering the native hook with the underlying operating system.
        Since:
        1.1

      • unregisterNativeHook

        public static void unregisterNativeHook()
        Disable the native hook if it is currently registered. If the native hook it is not registered the function has no effect.
        Since:
        1.1

      • isNativeHookRegistered

        public static boolean isNativeHookRegistered()
        Returns true if the native hook is currently registered.
        Returns:
        true if the native hook is currently registered.
        Throws:
        NativeHookException - the native hook exception
        Since:
        1.1

      • dispatchEvent

        public final void dispatchEvent(NativeInputEvent e)
        Dispatches an event to the appropriate processor. This method is generally called by the native library but maybe used to synthesize native events from Java.
        Parameters:
        e - the NativeInputEvent to dispatch.

      • processKeyEvent

        protected void processKeyEvent(NativeKeyEvent e)
        Processes native key events by dispatching them to all registered NativeKeyListener objects.
        Parameters:
        e - the NativeKeyEvent to dispatch.
        See Also:
        NativeKeyEvent, NativeKeyListener, addNativeKeyListener(NativeKeyListener)

      • processMouseEvent

        protected void processMouseEvent(NativeMouseEvent e)
        Processes native mouse events by dispatching them to all registered NativeMouseListener objects.
        Parameters:
        e - the NativeMouseEvent to dispatch.
        See Also:
        NativeMouseEvent, NativeMouseListener, addNativeMouseListener(NativeMouseListener)

      • processMouseWheelEvent

        protected void processMouseWheelEvent(NativeMouseWheelEvent e)
        Processes native mouse wheel events by dispatching them to all registered NativeMouseWheelListener objects.
        Parameters:
        e - The NativeMouseWheelEvent to dispatch.
        Since:
        1.1
        See Also:
        NativeMouseWheelEvent, NativeMouseWheelListener, addNativeMouseWheelListener(NativeMouseWheelListener)

      • startEventDispatcher

        protected void startEventDispatcher()
        Initialize a local executor service for event delivery. This method should only be called by the native library during the hook registration process.
        Since:
        1.1

      • stopEventDispatcher

        protected void stopEventDispatcher()
        Shutdown the local executor service for event delivery. Any events events pending delivery will be discarded. This method should only be called by the native library during the hook deregistration process.
        Since:
        1.1

      • loadNativeLibrary

        protected static void loadNativeLibrary()
        Perform procedures to interface with the native library. These procedures include unpacking and loading the library into the Java Virtual Machine.

      • unloadNativeLibrary

        protected static void unloadNativeLibrary()
                                   throws NativeHookException
        Perform procedures to cleanup the native library. This method is called on garbage collection to ensure proper native cleanup.
        Throws:
        NativeHookException
